Message.Title: How come....?
Message.Msg: A company w an offer higher than the current price, and this offer will be refused because all shareholders think its worth more, and Icahn saying he'll bid between 15-18$ is trading way lower than all these scenarios. The only thing i can think of is the Dell offer will fail and the market isn't expecting any other offers! Any other scenario I'm missing? Cause if the market feels a bigger offer will show it would trade above the current offer price not below it! Market must think Icahn is full of it with his offer and just bluffing to make Dell go up a bit on his offer!

Topic.Title: How come....?

Message.Msg: If Icahn actually bids $15 or more, cash, the board would likely accept it. What he has proposed so far is a recapitalization.
